column5: Amazing.  I guess you didnt see the N/C eh Rob   Nice meeting you finaly and thanks for the BPS gift card.You really didnt have to.   GL on the BOQ.
*SMILES*
No dream... if you know the two perps involved Blair..
You made something that I will be trusting with my life, and its made 10x better then anything that I could have bought if I had been able to find one.  Don't spend that gift card all in one place.
If any one else wants to know where they sell them, the causeway bait shop in port perry sells some nice ones for 30 bucks.
or Brian can make you one for a good 'deal' if needed.
Geoff.. lets not put his employer out of business!! LOL
Hey Brian very cool. Good luck Rob. Do you need anything else rob?
I meant me...  LOL. He still needs to tell me if he want's the free ski's...
A couple of class acts I'd say. Good on ya both.

I don't work there I just seen a couple kicking around today. And I'm sure you don't want to start pumping out a full line of spuds for everyone on the board, but then again it wouldn't surprise me lol.
Sorry GoneFishin.. but "Geoff" was GBW.. and "employer" would be Misfish's.
Well it's been a few years since I've used my spud, and I can't find it.  Went to a few tackle stores today and struck-out. I'm going to call Tromblys in Orillia.
why don't you PM Brian to see what he can do for ya?
Dont be going and doing silly things like that.When ya need it for? I,ll make ya one. You just got to pick it up.
Serious?
Yep, a 1" piece of rebar with a chunk of 2"X3"X3/8" plate welded to the end and sharpend does the trick for me.
I've had one of these for about 5 years, best chisel I've ever owned.  I think I paid $50 for it.  http://www.sportsmansguide.com/net/cb/jiffy-mini-mille-lacs-ice-chisel.aspx?a=242760
Heading to Quinte (fingers crossed for weather) this Saturday. No issues picking it up.
whoa, look at that great offer. look's like I have to make a trip up in a few weeks to drop off a set of ski's...
My brother's got a heavy duty Cedar Spud with a 4 inch cutting end.... 3 wacks and he's through 5 or 6 inches of ice. You "could" make one..... but it sounds like MisFish has the best deal though!!!
Good idea for Quinte , the place that is Never safe
why cant i use a hammer?
That's how I feel about it. Plus living 3hours away I don't know what the real weather was like leading up to a fishing trip.
Better than flat bar stock. Go to your local spring shop and buy a piece of spring steel maybe 10" and weld to 1"pipe. Just the best. But don't pry with it.
I dont pay for mine,but you are right,best and dont pry.

lol i just made one at work. 4' length of 15mm rebar, put a piece on top in a T shape just incase it slips outta my hand it wont fall through the hole, and a piece of 5" plate sleel, bout a 1/4" thick and roughly 2" wide, sharpened to a nice cutting edge, welded it all together and even had it painted a nice pretty blue.  cost me nuthin, infact, i was being paid while i made it haha.
Awesome .. give ya $50 for it

Because I do not have the resources to make my own, nor freinds that can make it cheaper than I can buy one.  I purchased mine at TSC.  The one I got was about 6' long and cost me $30.00.  They had about four different styles to pick from.
Not true. I scrap pc heavy pipe,n/c,1 piece of brake spring,n/c.Handy welder near by,n/c.Eat lunch while working away on own time,n/c,do it all the time.1 spud ready for pick up Rob.n/c.
Hey Brian. I'll be up in Phelpston the first weekend in Feb.  Let me know if you want me to bring up the downhill skiis. Geoff
Will do bud.THX
*SMILES*
..Yah but be careful, he'll follow you to your favourite fishing spot to show you how to use it !!
I DONT need spots.Have enough thanks.Looks like the decline of clowns,ya might need some.   Thanks blairwelsh.

Not true. I scrap pc heavy pipe,n/c,1 piece of brake spring,n/c.Handy welder near by,n/c.Eat lunch while working away on own time,n/c,do it all the time.1 spud ready for pick up Rob.n/c.  Yeah but then I would have to buy gas for the truck and all new ice fishing gear to be able to follow you out to one of your best fishing holes  .  And you live at least 4 hrs away from me.  I got the right friends, just in the wrong places
